inject.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to put liquid, especially a drug, into someoneâ€™s body by using a special needle
inject.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: The drug is injected directly into the base of the spine.
I have to inject myself with insulin.
inject.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to improve something by adding excitement, interest etc to it
inject.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Traditional handbag makers are injecting more fun into their designs.
A market building can inject new life into an area.
inject.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to provide more money, equipment etc for something
inject.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: They need to inject more money into sports facilities.
inject.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to provide money, ideas, skills etc for an organization or an activity, to make it perform better or to stop it from failing
inject.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: This was an opportunity to inject some life into the campaign.
It injected new capital into the company.
